Bash(git commit -m "$(cat <<''EOF''
feat: add per-branch autoMerge configuration for hybrid manual/auto workflow

Add support for configurable auto-merge behavior per target branch, allowing
teams to choose when to automatically fast-forward branches vs requiring manual
PR review.

Changes:
- Add autoMerge config option supporting both boolean and per-branch object
- Update pipeline template to conditionally generate branch job based on config
- Add branch output to manage-branch action for workflow triggering
- Implement workflow dispatch triggering to run pipeline on target branch
- Add logic to remove branch job when autoMerge is disabled

Configuration:
- Set autoMerge per target branch in .pipecraftrc.json
- Example: { "staging": true, "main": false }
- Enables auto-merge to staging, manual review for production

Workflow behavior:
- When autoMerge enabled: creates PR + auto fast-forward + triggers workflow
- When autoMerge disabled: creates PR + waits for manual merge (human merge triggers workflow)
- Uses GITHUB_TOKEN with gh workflow run (no PAT needed)
- Branch job includes conditional if statement based on source branch

This solves the issue where GITHUB_TOKEN pushes don''t trigger workflows by
explicitly triggering them, while maintaining flexibility for manual review
when needed (e.g., before production deploys).
